item.title: Kenny Willenberg
item.description: I am very active as a Semi-Pro Chess Player on the Elite South African Chess Scene and a High Performance Private Chess Trainer with over 20 years experience coaching at all levels. On a National Level I am proud to still hold the record for most consecutive SA Junior Titles winning the National Junior Championship (SAJCC) in U16 - U20 an unprecedented 5 years in a row including being 2 Time Winner of SA Junior Closed (SAJCCC) The most prestigious Junior Chess event in South Africa.

item.title: Lyndon Bouah
item.description: Dr. Lyndon Bouah is a distinguished figure in South African chessâ€”both as a competitive veteran and as a scholar-administrator. Holding the title of Candidate Master, he has represented his nation at events including the 1992 and 1994 Chess Olympiads. In 2024, Bouah made a remarkable return to competitive play, emerging as co-champion in the Senior Section of the South African Closed Chess Championship, achieving an undefeated 8.5/11 alongside Dr. Shabier Bhawoodien. Off the board, Dr. Bouah is a committed researcher and author, notably publishing Reflection on Chess in the Rainbow Nation, a deeply personal and cultural exploration of chess in South Africa. He also serves as the Chief Director for Sport and Recreation in the Western Cape, blending his passion for chess with leadership in public service.
